meanings.definition: The act of constructing or using a canal.
meanings.sent1: The canaling of the new waterway brought much-needed irrigation to the fields.
meanings.sent2: The canaling project aimed to connect the two rivers for easier transportation.
meanings.sent3: The ducks seemed to enjoy canaling through the small watercourse in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed smoothly, canaling through the peaceful channels of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The workers toiled under the sun, canaling tirelessly to complete the canal.

meanings.definition: The process of transporting goods or people through a canal.
meanings.sent1: The canaling of goods along the waterway was efficient and cost-effective.
meanings.sent2: The company specialized in canaling products to different regions via the canal network.
meanings.sent3: The tourists enjoyed canaling through the historic canal, taking in the sights.
meanings.sent4: The ideas flowed freely, canaling from one department to another in the company.
meanings.sent5: The barges moved slowly, canaling their way through the narrow canal with precision.

meanings.definition: The act of navigating a canal.
meanings.sent1: The captain's expertise in canaling the ship through the canal was commendable.
meanings.sent2: The team practiced canaling the boat through the winding canal to improve their skills.
meanings.sent3: The children had fun canaling the toy boats in the bathtub during bath time.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts meandered, canaling through the memories of her childhood adventures.
meanings.sent5: The explorer faced challenges while canaling the uncharted canal in search of treasure.
